title: Fix Training Document #2 PDF link to open the static PDF in a new tab

requirements.summary: Ensure Training Document #2 line-2 link opens the actual PDF in a new tab (like Training Document #1) and does not navigate within the SPA.
acceptanceCriteria: In the Training Documents section, clicking Training Document #2 line-2 text opens a PDF file directly (browser PDF viewer) in a new tab/window.
Clicking Training Document #1 line-2 text continues to open its PDF directly (no regression).
Training Document #2 link does not route to the React app (no hash/SPA navigation; no page that looks like the site home).

file_operations.description: Update the Training Documents rendering so Training Document #2 always resolves to a concrete static .pdf under /assets/... (and still uses target="_blank"), preventing SPA navigation when the backend-provided documentUrl is missing/incorrect. Keep the strict two-line layout/typography unchanged and avoid changes to Training Document #1 behavior.

requirements.summary: Ensure the Training Document #2 documentUrl resolves to a publicly served static PDF under the frontend /assets path so the resolved URL returns a PDF (not index.html).
acceptanceCriteria: The static file referenced by Training Document #2 `documentUrl` exists in the frontend public assets and is reachable at the resolved `/assets/...` URL.
Requesting the resolved URL for Training Document #2 returns `Content-Type: application/pdf` (or otherwise opens as a PDF in the browser), not the site HTML shell.

Backend `getTrainingDocuments()` continues to return Training Document #2 title exactly as currently set ("The Codex of Value: Determining what Truly Matters.") unless a new PDF filename/path is explicitly provided elsewhere in the project inputs.

file_operations.description: Add the static PDF asset that Training Document #2 should open, ensuring it is served as a real PDF from the frontend static assets (so the resolved /assets/... URL does not fall back to the SPA HTML).

Harden getStaticAssetUrl usage expectations for document links by ensuring it consistently produces an /assets/... URL suitable for direct file responses (PDF) even when filenames include spaces/special characters; keep behavior for absolute URLs unchanged.
